content.location: Kashmir Boulder, left side.  Left of Rockhouse Traverse.
On Kashmir boulder. Located on the right side of Rockhouse traverse. In between Nora's mantle and Heaven arête
Located on the Kashmir boulder. The obvious long crack going up right. To the left of Conondrum

content.description: Look for the long left to right traverse that features a crack and sloped edged for hands and smearing on crystals for feet.  After you got it down, reverse and go back.
content.location: 5 minutes from the Parking, across Fire Woman and Lost Digits.
Located on Kashmir boulder. On the right side of Rockhouse traverse. To the left of Nora's Mantle

content.description: Classic crack climb at Boat Rock.  Rated 5.9 in the 2005 comp guide, I've also seen it listed as 5.10.  I've seen the crack started several different ways, but the crux seems to always be 3/4 of the way up the crack.  There is a nice jug at the very top.  Not as hard as Beam me up Scotty, but not as easy as Blues Crack.
content.location: Route is located directly to the left of the Pizza Before Cake Boulder.  Left arching hand/finger crack.  Walk off the back to get down.

content.description: Climb the Corner arête. starts on the left of the long crack going right.
content.location: On Kashmir Boulder in between Stubby crack and Stairway to Heaven. If you are looking at the boulder from watermelon or Paint Can area it is on the right side of that arête.

content.description: Using the holds on the left side of the arete for the left hand position your foot onto one of the edges on the face.  Roll onto that foot and get comfortable.  From here reach up and find that lone large crystal.  High step onto the arete and walk it out.
content.location: Walking into BR it is on the right right after pizza before cake and right before paint can.  It is directly left of kashmir and most directly left of connudrum[V8] on the same block.  This is the corner arete with leaning hand crack around the corner to the left.

content.description: Same as Dimples but using the seam to the right (from Rockhouse Traverse) to get started.
content.location: To the left of Rockhouse Traverse in the Paint Can area.

content.description: The name says it all -- it's a slab with dimples (though not as many as you might like).  Three or four tenuous, balancy moves will get you up to where the rock quickly becomes less steep and you're home free.
content.location: Starts about 10' left of the Rockhouse Traverse.

content.description: This is a fun problem with dynamic movement.
content.location:
Conundrum is on the boulder between Fire Woman and Pizza Before Cake and faces Pizza Before Cake. 

  Start matched on a huge jug and really crappy feet. Make a huge deadpoint to an edge and finagle your way upwards. 

  The topout is not hard, but a little heady. 

  The Float the Boat Guidebook lists Conundrum as a V7... this is likely generous.

content.description: The name refers to the direction of topout, not the starting position. Starts five feet to the right of Rockhouse Traverse and just left of Black Snake Crack Left on some good handholds and tiny feet. Trends upward and to the right up some twin cracks.

The name refers to the direction of topout, not the starting position. Starts to the right of Black Snake Crack Right on some good handholds and tiny feet, then trends upward and to the left along an undercling.
